comment: This is the typical college class, but Professor Orrock is open to questions and teaches at a pace so that everyone understands. Tests are similar to the study guide, which is similar to the notes. Notes are provided, a sheet is allowed for tests, and TI-84 calculator is allowed (TI-84 Plus CE worked well). Show up to class=you are sure to pass.

Best math teacher I've ever had, always struggled with math & stats in high school, he makes everything so easy to understand. Only 3 tests, allowed notes on them. Recommend all my friends to take him!

Took him in the spring & he was great! Definitely recommend, he makes sure the class understands before moving on & moves due dates if necessary instead of rushing through chapters. He encourages question & provides study guides that actually match his exams. Attend class, pay attention, & do the homework and study guides and you'll get an A easily

Definitely the best professor I've had at KSU, tests reflect the study guide and he actually cares about his students and their academic success. Super cool and funny guy and I never feel dumb for asking questions. Would definitely take him for Stats especially if math is a hard subject for you. Moves deadlines if he dosent cover all info in class

The tests were very similar to study guides. Aleks homework due the day before the exam. You can be exempt from the final if you have a 95% average of all tests, homework, and get at least 75% on FCAR quiz. As long as you don't fall behind then it's not a difficult class.

Professor Orrock is a very caring person. He explains the problems really well where anyone can easily comprehend. His grades consist of aleks homework which isn't much and three tests with a final. He gives a study guide for the test which is practically the same as the test, just different numbers. He also lets you use a flashcard and TI-84 calc.

I have never been good at any kind of math but Professor Orrock changed that for me. He is an amazing teacher who explains all the topics in depth with plenty of practice problems worked in class. I always felt prepared for the tests. He is extremely attentive and caring towards his students, he will always answer any questions thoroughly.

This is by far my favorite professor. I can not thank him enough for the sheer amount of grace he gave me.
I almost failed his class do to lack of work and effort, nothing to do with him. He saved my academic career.

All I got to say is do the homework and quizzes and you'll be golden.

He was the best professor!! He's really patient and willing to explain your question in numerous ways if you dont understand. He never made me feel stupid in class for asking questions and never called anyone out for the answers either. The class consist of 3 tests and you get a notecard for the formulas. Homework weekly. Take him!!!

I was so afraid because in high school I had a TERRIBLE AP Stat teacher. But THIS was so pleasantly easy. The professor made it so easy to understand. He is AWESOME at explaining the material and is super understanding and lenient in his test grading. There is homework every week, but it's easy. It maybe takes an hour. Love this teacher!

Professor Orrock is great! I have never passed a math class with a B before I took his stats class. He explains statistics in a way that just makes sense, he tends to break down what he is doing as he teaches it. He also talks to you after class and is so caring to make sure you submit the work needed in order for you to pass. I highly recommend!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Steve Orrock was one of the best math professors I've ever had. I don't always understand math and never had that problem with this class thanks to the professor. He was nice, easy going, clear about his content, what we were going to be graded on, and was very communicative. He gives tips to those who attend class! Highly recommend!

Professor Orrock is awesome. Stat isn't the easiest for everyone, but he puts it in very simple terms. Grade is most comprised mostly of three tests, with homework through ALEKS. Make sure to do and understand the study guides and you should ace the exams. He is also just a very nice person and very respectable. Exempt final if grade is above 95.

Super nice and helpful professor who wants his students to learn! He goes above and beyond when it comes to preparing students for tests and quizzes. All you have to do is show up, participate, and you are guaranteed to understand the material.

Overall, I really enjoyed his class. You could skip class and learn from the textbook, but I found going to class made life easier. He is very monotone, but the teaching notes help you to stay engaged. He doesn't mind stopping to explain a question a student asks.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Orrock isn't a bad professor he's just not super energetic or super engaged. I found myself almost falling asleep in most classes. I had to go to tutoring every week to get a good grade because I guess he just teach in a way I could understand. Not too much busy work, just a few homework sections every week.

Pretty typical young teacher. Class is pretty tedious but he lets you use the "give example" feature to help walk you through things. Not a phenomenal class but if you put in the work it is an easy pass.

Had to drop this class because of the way it was structured. I didn't do well with his way of teaching since he mostly just went over worksheets and we learned from a different professor's videos. He was nice, it was just too inconsistent for me.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria
